ASPIRIN WITH CODEINE

  • Indications and doses
  • Constituants
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Less suitable for prescribing
  • Exceptions to legal category
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Mild to moderate pain, Pyrexia,

By mouth

  • For adults
    1–2 tablets every 4–6 hours as required, dose to be dispersed in water; maximum 8 tablets per day.

Constituents

aspirin codeine phosphate

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

When co-codaprin tablets or dispersible tablets are prescribed and no strength is stated, tablets or dispersible tablets, respectively, containing codeine phosphate 8 mg and aspirin 400 mg should be dispensed.

Conditions when less suitable for prescribing

Aspirin with codeine is less suitable for prescribing.

Exceptions to legal category

Aspirin with codeine can be sold to the public provided packs contain no more than 32 capsules or tablets; pharmacists can sell multiple packs up to a total quantity of 100 capsules or tablets in justifiable circumstances.

Prepared medicinal forms of ASPIRIN WITH CODEINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
Dispersible tablet
